message_1: A student is given the value of the sine of an angle as 0.6. Using inverse trigonometric functions, find the value of the angle in degrees.
message_2:
To find the angle whose sine is 0.6, we can use the inverse sine function, also known as the arcsine function. The notation for this is sin^(-1)(x) or arcsin(x).

So, we have sin^(-1)(0.6) = angle.

Now, we can use a calculator to find the value of the angle in radians:

sin^(-1)(0.6) ≈ 0.6435 radians.

To convert this value from radians to degrees, we can use the following formula:

angle (in degrees) = angle (in radians) × (180°/π)

angle (in degrees) ≈ 0.6435 × (180°/π) ≈ 36.87°

Therefore, the angle is approximately 36.87°.
